question: [File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Value Zero] Can div_with_oracle_price(0, price) enable attacker to claim zero shares represent infinite value? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_oracle_price_decimals()] [Near-Max Value] Can to_oracle_price_decimals(2^238) cause overflow, breaking oracle integration in vault? (Critical)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: from_oracle_price_decimals()] [One Wei] Can from_oracle_price_decimals(1e18-1) round to zero, causing oracle price to be ignored? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Max Index] Can parse_key() with idx=255 create excessively long key strings, causing storage or parsing issues? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Single Entry] Can VecMap with one entry be cloned correctly, or does loop logic fail with length()=1? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Gas Exhaustion] Can repeated mul_d() calls in loops exhaust gas when vault processes many deposit requests? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Large Map] Can attacker create VecMap with thousands of entries, causing clone to exceed gas limits and DoS config updates? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Panic Attack] Can attacker repeatedly call operations that trigger div_d(x, 0), causing panic and DoS? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Overflow Panic] Can orchestrated overflow in mul_with_oracle_price() cause vault valuation to panic, freezing withdrawals? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Generic Type T] Can attacker pass non-asset type to parse_key(), creating keys that collide with legitimate asset storage? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: clone_vecmap_table()] [Generic Constraints] Can T0 or T1 types without proper traits cause unexpected behavior in clone, breaking invariants? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: parse_key()] [Type Spoofing] Can two types with identical string representations but different origins produce same key? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Commutative Property] Does mul_d(a, b) = mul_d(b, a) always hold, or can ordering affect rounding? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Inverse Property] Does div_d(mul_d(x, y), y) perfectly recover x, or can rounding cause drift? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Associative Property] Does mul_with_oracle_price(mul_with_oracle_price(x, p1), p2) = mul_with_oracle_price(x, p1*p2/1e18) hold? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: decimals()] [Getter Purity] Can decimals() be relied upon to always return 1e9, or can storage corruption change returned value? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Small Values] Can mul_d(1, 1) = 0 due to rounding, bypassing minimum operation amounts? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Large Denominators] Can div_d(1e9, 1e18) = 0, causing division by zero in subsequent calculations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Micro Balances] Can mul_with_oracle_price(1, price) round to zero for any reasonable price, losing track of small balances? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [High Prices] Can div_with_oracle_price(value, 1e25) cause overflow when multiplying value by 1e18? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: to_decimals()] [Sub-Unit Values] Can to_decimals() properly handle values < 1 native unit, or does it only work for integers? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_d()] [Semantic Correctness] Is dividing after multiplication the correct order, or should it be (v1/DECIMALS)*v2 to prevent overflow? (High)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_d()] [Order Dependency] Should v1 be multiplied before dividing, or does this cause unnecessary overflow risk? (Medium)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: mul_with_oracle_price()] [Formula Correctness] Is dividing by ORACLE_DECIMALS correct, or should result be in different units? (Low)
[File: volo-vault/sources/utils.move] [Function: div_with_oracle_price()] [Inverse Correctness] Is multiplying by ORACLE_DECIMALS before division the correct inverse of mul_with_oracle_price()? (Low)
